definition: noun pleasure-boat; touring boat
noun drawing; picture; painting
noun commerce; trade; business

noun 1 condition; term; factor 貿易條件 màoyì tiáojiàn terms of trade 自然條件 zìrán tiáojiàn natural conditions 利用有利的條件 lìyòng yǒulì de tiáojiàn make use of the favourable factors 在目前條件下 zài mùqián tiáojiàn xià given the present conditions; under present circumstances 在對等的條件下給予優惠待遇 zài duì děng de tiáojiàn xià jǐyǔ yōuhuì dàiyù give preferential treatment on a reciprocal basis 這個工廠生產條件很好。 zhège gōngchǎng shēngchǎn tiáojiàn hěn hǎo. This factory has all the right conditions for production. 2 requirement; prerequisite; qualification 提出條件 Tíchū tiáojiàn list the prerequisites; put forward the requirements 當宇航員對身體條件要求很嚴。 Dāng yǔhángyuán duì shēntǐ tiáojiàn yāoqiú hěn yán. The physical fitness requirements for being an astronaut are very stiff. 做這項工作需要具備什麼條件？ Zuò zhè xiàng gōngzuò xūyào jùbèi shénme tiáojiàn？ What qualifications are needed for this job?
verb bear fruit; fructify 這棵樹去年結了好多果兒。 Zhè kē shù qùnián jiē le hǎoduō guǒr. This tree bore a lot of fruit last year.

verb take no care of; not look after 他整天忙, 從來不管孩子。 Tā zhěngtiān máng, cónglái bùguǎn háizi. He is always busy and never has time to care for his child. 他對公司裡的事不管不顧。 Tā duì gōngsī lǐ de shì bùguǎn bù gù. He has no interest in what’s going on in the company. 
conjunction regardless of; no matter (what, who, etc.) 不管多大的困難, 我們都能克服。 bùguǎn duō dà de kùnnan, wǒmen dōu néng kèfú. We can overcome any difficulty, however great. 不管他來不來, 我們(都)得走了。 bùguǎn tā lái bù lái, wǒmen děi zǒu le. Regardless of whether he comes or not, we’ve got to leave. 不管怎樣我不想去。 Bùguǎnzěnyàng wǒ bù xiǎng qù. In any case I don’t want to go.

verb 1 forget 我永遠不會忘記我們初次見面的那一天。 wǒ yǒngyuǎn bù huì wàngjì wǒmen chūcì jiànmiàn de nà yī tiān. I’ll never forget the day we first met. 2 overlook; neglect 不能忘記自己的責任。 Bùnéng wàngjì zìjǐ de zérèn. One mustn’t neglect one’s duties.

noun 1 connections; relations; relationship 搞好關係 gǎohǎo guānxi build good personal relations 家庭關係 jiātíng guānxi family connections; family (or familial) relations 托人找關係 tuōrén zhǎo guānxi seek for special connections 他們的關係不好。 Tāmen de guānxi bù hǎo. They are not on good terms. 她和老闆的關係很好。 tā hé lǎobǎn deguānxi hěn hǎo. She’s well in with her boss. 2 [often used correlatively with 沒有, 有] relevance; bearing; influence; significance 你去不去, 關係不大。 Nǐ qù bù qù, guānxi bùdà. Your going or not won’t make much difference. 這件事跟我沒有關係。 Zhè jiàn shì gēn wǒ méiyǒu guānxi. This matter has nothing to do with me. 這一點對今後工作關係重大。 Zhè yīdiǎn duì jīnhòu gōngzuò guānxi zhòngdà. This has an important bearing on our future work. 3 [usu. with 由於 or 因為 to indicate cause or reason] 由於時間關係, 就談到這裡吧。 Yóuyú shíjiān guānxi, jiù tán dào zhèlǐ ba. Time is limited, so I’ll stop here. 4 credentials showing membership in or affiliation with an organization 組織關係 zǔzhī guānxi membership credentials (or papers) 5 euphemistic (extramarital) sexual relations 發生關係 fāshēng guānxi have sexual relations with sb. (not as husband and wife); have an affair 
verb concern; affect; have a bearing on; have to do with 環保關係到國家的可持續發展。 Huán-bǎo guānxi dào guójiā de kěchíxù fāzhǎn. Environmental protection directly affects sustainable development in our country.

adjective special; particular; out of the ordinary 特別的愛好 tèbié de àihào an unusual hobby 他的口音很特別。 Tā de kǒuyin hěn tèbié. He has a peculiar accent. 這棟樓的設計沒有什麼特別的地方。 Zhè dòng lóu de shèjì méiyǒu shénmetèbié de dìfang. The design of this building is nothing out of the ordinary. 這種花每當夜晚就散發出一種特別的香味兒。 Zhèzhǒng huā měidāng yèwǎn jiù sànfā chū yī zhǒng tèbié de xiāngwèir. As evening approaches, this flower gives off a distinctive fragrance. 
adverb 1 especially; particularly 質量特別好 zhìliàng tèbié hǎo of extra fine quality 工作特別努力 Gōngzuò tèbié nǔlì especially hard-working 建設一支特別能戰鬥的隊伍 jiànshè yī zhī tèbié néng zhàndòu de duìwu train a contingent of exceptional fighters 今天特別熱。 Jīntiān tèbié rè. It’s extremely hot today. 這個報告特別有教育意義。 zhège bàogào tèbié yǒu jiàoyù yìyì. The talk was particularly instructive. 2 for a special purpose; specially; deliberately 他臨走時特別去向女主人道謝。 Tā línzǒu shí tèbié qùxiàng nǚzhǔrén dàoxiè. He made a point of thanking his hostess before he left the party. 這些花是我特別為你摘的。 Zhèxiē huā shì wǒ tèbié wèi nǐ zhāi de. I picked these flowers specially for you. 3 all the more; in particular 他喜愛體育, 特別是籃球。 Tā xǐ'ài tǐyù, tèbié shì lánqiú. He loves sports, particularly basketball. 這裡最需要醫務人員, 特別是外科醫生。 Zhèlǐ zuì xūyào yīwù rényuán, tèbié shì wàikē yīshēng. There’s a huge need for medical workers here, especially surgeons.

noun beginning; outset; commencement 一開始 yī kāishǐ at the very beginning 一種新的工作, 開始總會遇到一些困難。 Yī zhǒng xīn de gōngzuò, kāishǐ zǒng huì yùdào yīxiē kùnnan. You always run into some difficulties at the beginning of a new job. 
verb begin; start; commence 開始生效 kāishǐ shēngxiào take effect; come into effect (or force) 從頭開始 cóngtóu kāishǐ start from the very beginning 開始討論實質性問題 Kāishǐ tǎolùn shízhìxìng wèntí come to substantive questions 今天從第五課開始。 Jīntiān cóng dì-wǔ kè kāishǐ. Today we’ll begin with Lesson 5. 他們開始了旅行中最危險的階段。 Tāmenkāishǐ le lǚxíng zhōng zuì wēixiǎn de jiēduàn. They entered upon the most dangerous part of the journey.

adjective 1 simple; uncomplicated (opp. 複雜) 簡單明了 jiǎndānmíngliǎo simple and clear; concise and explicit 簡單拼湊 jiǎndān pīncòu simply piercing together 吃得很簡單 Chī de hěn jiǎndān have simple food 生活得很簡單 shēnghuó de hěn jiǎndān lead a simple life 事情沒那麼簡單。 Shìqing méi nàme jiǎndān. There is more to it. 這機器構造簡單。 Zhè jīqì gòuzào jiǎndān. The machine is simple in structure. 2 [usu. in the negative] commonplace; ordinary 她的槍法那麼準, 真不簡單。 Tā de qiāngfǎ nàme zhǔn, zhēn bù jiǎndān. She’s a marvel to be able to shoot with such accuracy. 這家伙鬼點子特多, 可不簡單。 Zhè jiāhuo guǐdiǎnzi tè duō, kě bù jiǎndān. This fellow is no simpleton. He is full of tricks. 3 oversimplified; casual 簡單粗暴 jiǎndāncūbào do things in an oversimplified and crude way 不能用簡單的方法去解決這個問題。 Bù néng yòng jiǎndān de fāngfǎ qù jiějué zhège wèntí. This matter cannot be settled in a summary fashion. 這篇文章我只是簡單地看了看。 Zhè piān wénzhāng wǒ zhǐshì jiǎndān de kàn le kàn. I only skimmed through this article.

verb handle; conduct; transact 辦理進出口業務 bànlǐ jìnchūkǒu yèwù handle imports and exports 辦理入境手續 bànlǐ rùjìng shǒuxù go through entry formalities (or procedures) 這些事情你可以斟酌辦理。 Zhèxiē shìqing nǐ kěyǐ zhēnzhuó bànlǐ. You may handle these matters as you see fit.

noun experience 個人經歷 Gèrén jīnglì personal experiences 生活經歷 shēnghuó jīnglì life experience 他這人經歷多, 見識廣。 Tā zhè rén jīnglì duō, jiànshi guǎng. He’s a man of wide knowledge and experience. 
verb go through; undergo; experience 現代科學技術正經歷著一場革命。 xiàndài kēxué jìshù zhèng jīnglì zhe yī cháng gémìng. Modern science and technology are in the throes of a revolution.

adjective 1 difficult 呼吸困難 hūxī kùnnan breathe with difficulty 2 financially difficult; economically straitened 生活困難 shēnghuó kùnnan live in straitened circumstances 
noun difficulty; hardness 困難重重 kùnnanchóngchóng be beset with difficulties 困難行業 kùnnan hángyè difficulty-ridden industry 困難職工 kùnnan zhígōng the needy (worker) 困難像彈簧, 你弱他就強。 kùnnan xiàng tánhuáng, nǐ ruò tājiù qiáng. Problems loom large when men don’t.

noun knowledge; intellect 知識淵博 zhīshi yuānbó wide knowledge; erudite; learned 知識密集型產業 zhīshi mìjí xíng chǎnyè knowledge-intensive industries 技術知識 jìshù zhīshi technical know-how 書本知識 shūběn zhīshi book learning 跟這種沒有知識的人議論嚴肅音樂本來就沒有意思。 Gēn zhèzhǒng méiyǒu zhīshi de rén yìlùn yánsù yīnyuè běnlái jiù méiyǒu yìsi. There’s no point discussing serious music with such ignorant people.

noun 1 general (or elementary) knowledge 科學常識 kēxué chángshí general knowledge of science 衛生常識 wèishēng chángshí elementary knowledge of hygiene and sanitation 2 common sense 天冷了要穿得暖一點兒, 這是常識。 tiān lěng le yào chuān de nuǎn yīdiǎnr, zhè shì chángshí. It’s common sense to dress more warmly in cold weather.

noun fact 與事實不符 Yǔ shìshí bùfú not tally with the facts 事實如此。 Shìshírúcǐ. This is how things are (or stand). 事實恰恰相反。 Shìshí qiàqià xiāngfǎn. The facts are just the opposite. or The opposite is the case. 事實俱在, 不容抵賴。 Shìshí jù zài, bù róng dǐlài. The facts are there and cannot be denied.
noun perfume; scent 噴香水 pēn xiāngshuǐ spray on perfume

verb 1 (dī) carry; hold (sth. with a handle) 手裡提著個籃子 Shǒulǐ tí zhe ge lánzi carry a basket in one hand 我去提壺水來。 Wǒ qù tí hú shuǐ lái. I will fetch a kettle of water. 2 lift; raise; promote 從井裡提水 Cóng jǐng lǐ tí shuǐ draw water from a well 把某人提到領導崗位上去 Bǎ mǒurén tídào lǐngdǎo gǎngwèi shàng qù promote sb. to a position of leadership 把問題提到原則高度來分析 bǎ wèntí tídào yuánzé gāodù lái fēnxi analyse a problem from the level of principle 把鞋提上。 Bǎ xié tí shàng. Pull your shoes on. 這種自行車很輕便, 一隻手就能提起來。 zhèzhǒng zìxíngchē hěn qīngbiàn, yī zhīshǒu jiù néng tí qǐlai. This bicycle is very light. You can lift it with one hand. 3 shift to an earlier time; move up a date 把會議的日期往前提 bǎ huìyì de rìqī wǎng qiántí move the date of the meeting up 4 put forward; bring up; raise 提方案 tí fāng'àn suggest (or propose) plans 提抗議 tí kàngyì lodge a protest 提條件 tí tiáojiàn put forward conditions 提問題 tí wèntí ask a question 提要求 tí yāoqiú make demands 提意見 tí yìjian make a criticism; make comments (or suggestions) 把事情提到會上去討論 bǎ shìqing tídào huì shàng qù tǎolùn take (or submit) the matter to the meeting for discussion 把計劃生育提到議事日程上來 bǎ jìhuà shēngyù tídào yìshì rìchéng shàng lái put family planning on the agenda 5 draw (or take) out; extract 我到車站提行李去。 Wǒ dào chēzhàn tí xíngli qù. I’m going to collect my luggage at the station. 銀行裡的這筆款子你提了沒有？ Yínháng lǐ de zhè bǐ kuǎnzi nǐ tí le méiyǒu？ Have you drawn the money from the bank? 6 summon (a prisoner) for interrogation 提犯人 Tí fànrén fetch a prisoner for interrogation 7 mention; refer to; bring up 別再提那件事了。 Bié zài tí nà jiàn shì le. Don’t bring that up again. 論文有幾處提到了該書。 Lùnwén yǒu jǐ chù tí dàoliǎo gāi shū. The paper contains several references to that book. 他提了一下這個計劃, 但沒有說明細節。 Tā tí le yīxià zhège jìhuà, dàn méiyǒu shuōmíng xìjié. He mentioned the plan, but gave no details. 
noun 1 dipper 油提 yóutí oil-dipper 2 rising stroke (in Chinese characters)

noun 1 drop (of liquid) 雨點兒 yǔdiǎnr raindrop 2 spot; dot; speck 墨點兒 mòdiǎnr ink spots 3 dot stroke (in Chinese characters) 4 mathematics point 兩點成一直線。 Liǎng diǎn chéng yī zhíxiàn. A straight line is formed by connecting two points. 5 decimal point; point 三點兒五 Sāndiǎnr wǔ three point five (3.5) 6 place; point 突破一點 tūpò yīdiǎn make a breakthrough at one point 7 aspect; feature 從這點上看 cóng zhè diǎn shàng kàn viewed from this aspect 對這一點沒人懷疑。 Duì zhè yīdiǎn méi rén huáiyí. Nobody has any doubt about that. 8 finance point 上證指數收漲44點。 Shàngzhèng Zhǐshù shōu zhǎng 44 diǎn. The Shanghai Composite Index ended up 44 points. 
verb 1 place a dot 點三個點兒表示省略 diǎn sān ge diǎnr biǎoshì shěnglüè a sequence of three dots marks an omission 2 touch on very briefly; skim 他用篙一點就把船撐開了。 Tā yòng gāo yīdiǎn jiù bǎ chuán chēng kāi le. He pushed the boat off with a shove of the pole. 她發言時點(到)了這件事。 tā fāyán shí diǎn le zhè jiàn shì. She touched on the matter in her speech. 3 drip 點眼藥 diǎn yǎnyào put drops in the eyes 4 sow in holes; dibble 點豆子 diǎn dòuzi dibble beans 5 check one by one; count 點貨 diǎnhuò check over goods; take stock 請把錢點一點。 Qǐng bǎ qián diǎn yī diǎn. Please count the money. 6 select; choose 他點了牛排。 Tā diǎn le niúpái. He ordered a steak. 7 hint; point out 一點他就明白了。 Yīdiǎn tā jiù míngbai le. He quickly took the hint. 8 light; burn; kindle 點燈 diǎn dēng light a lamp 他是火爆性子, 一點就著。 Tā shì huǒbào xìngzi, yīdiǎn jiùzhe. He’s got a fiery temper and flares up very quickly. 9 embellish; decorate 裝點 zhuāngdiǎn furnish; decorate 
measure word 1 a little; a bit; some 讀點兒魯迅 Dú diǎn r Lǔ Xùn read some of Lu Xun’s works 給我點兒紙。 gěi wǒ diǎn r zhǐ. Give me some paper, will you? 他今天好點兒了。 Tā jīntiān hǎo diǎn r le. He’s feeling a bit better today. 人的認識一點兒也不能離開實踐。 Rén de rènshi yī diǎn r yě bùnéng líkāi shíjiàn. Human knowledge cannot be separated from practice. 2 [for items] 我有幾點不成熟的想法。 Wǒ yǒu jǐ diǎn bù chéngshú de xiǎngfa. I have some tentative suggestions. 
noun 1 o'clock 上午九點(鐘) Shàngwǔ jiǔ diǎn zhōng nine o’clock in the morning 現在幾點了？ Xiànzài jǐ diǎn le？ What time is it now? 2 appointed time 到點了 Dào diǎn le it’s time (to do sth.) 3 VARIANT OF 76626147雲板yun2ban3雲板 dated iron bell or clapper (used by government offices or influential families to give time or announce an event) 
noun refreshments 茶點 chádiǎn tea and pastries 
noun printing point (a unit of measurement for type bodies)

noun 1 hook 衣鉤 yīgōu clothes-hook 魚鉤 yúgōu fishhook 2 calligraphy hook stroke 3 check mark; tick 打鉤 dǎgōu make a check mark 
verb 1 secure with a hook; hook 他的袖子給釘子鉤住了。 Tā de xiùzi gěi dīngzi gōu zhù le. His sleeve caught on a nail. 2 crochet 鉤花邊 gōu huābiān crochet lace 3 sew with large stitches 鉤貼邊 gōu tiēbiān sew on an edging 4 spoken form for the numeral 9 on certain occasions 5 (Gōu) a surname

verb turn sideways; slant 把桌子斜過來 bǎ zhuōzi xié guòlai turn the table sideways 
adjective oblique; slanting; inclined; tilted 斜著眼看人 xié zhe yǎn kàn rén cast sidelong glances at sb.; look sideways at sb. 斜躺在沙發上 Xié tǎng zài shāfā shàng recline on a sofa 這根線斜了。 Zhè gēn xiàn xié le. The line is slanting. 柱子有點兒斜。 zhùzi yǒudiǎnrxié. The pillar is a little tilted.

adjective vertical; upright; perpendicular (opp. 橫) 竪放 shù fàng put sth. vertically 畫一條竪線 huà yī tiáo shùxiàn draw a vertical line 
verb set upright; erect; stand 竪旗杆 shù qígān erect a flagpole 竪大拇指 shù dàmuzhǐ hold up an approving thumb 這杆子我竪不起來。 Zhè gānzi wǒ shù bù qǐlai. I can’t get the pole to stand up. 
noun vertical stroke (in Chinese characters) “王”字的寫法是三橫一竪。 “Wáng” zì de xiěfǎ shì sān héng yī shù. The character 王 is composed of one vertical and three horizontal strokes. 
noun literary archaic young servant

verb press down; restrain 捺著性子 nàzhe xìngzi control one’s temper 勉強捺住心頭的怒火 miǎnqiǎng nà zhù xīntóu de nùhuǒ barely manage to restrain one’s anger 
noun right-falling stroke ()

noun 1 discount; rebate 打八折 dǎ bā zhé give 20% discount; charge 80% of the original price 2 turning stroke 
measure word an act of zaju (雜劇) 
verb 1 break; snap 折斷腿 zhéduàn tuǐ fracture (or break) one’s leg 折斷一根樹枝 zhéduàn yī gēn shùzhī break off a branch 2 suffer the loss of; lose 損兵折將 sǔnbīng-zhéjiàng suffer heavy losses 3 bend; twist 曲折 qūzhé twists and turns 4 turn back; change direction 邊界由此折向西南。 Biānjiè yóucǐ zhé xiàng xīnán. From here the boundary turns southwestward. 5 convinced; filled with admiration 心折 xīnzhé deeply convinced; filled with heartfelt admiration 6 convert into; amount to 把市斤折成公斤 bǎ shìjīn zhé chéng gōngjīn convert (or change) jin into kilograms 這筆外幣折成人民幣是多少？ Zhè bǐ wàibì zhé chéng rénmínbì shì duōshao？ How much does this foreign excharge convert into Renminbi? 
noun folded booklet with a slipcase, used for keeping accounts, etc.; folder 存折 cúnzhé account book 
verb fold 把信折好 bǎ xìn zhé hǎo fold the letter 把紙對折起來 bǎ zhǐ duìzhé qǐlai fold the sheet of paper in two

adjective 1 horizontal; transverse (opp. 豎, 直) 橫線 héngxiàn a horizontal line 2 from east to west or from west to east (opp. 縱) See 22625024橫貫heng2guan4橫貫 3 at a right angle to (opp. 直, 縱) See 22628608橫剖面heng2pou1mian4橫剖面 4 unrestrained; turbulent 老淚橫流 lǎolèihéngliú tears flowing from aged eyes 蔓草橫生 màncǎo héng shēng overgrown with creepers 5 [meaning much the same as 橫 hèng 1, limited to use in idiomatic expressions] violent; fierce; flagrant See 22633472橫行霸道heng2xing2ba4dao4橫行霸道 
verb 1 lie crosswise; be sideways 中文也能橫著寫。 Zhōngwén yě néng héng zhe xiě. Chinese can also be written across the page. 他橫在長沙發上看報。 Tā héng zài chángshāfā shàng kànbào. He reclined on the settee reading the newspaper. 一棵倒了的樹橫在馬路上。 Yī kē dǎo le de shù héng zài mǎlù shàng. A fallen tree lay across the road. 2 place sth. crosswise (or horizontally) 把扁擔橫過來。 Bǎ biǎndan héng guò lái. Put the carrying pole in a horizontal position. 把桌子橫過來。 bǎ zhuōzihéng guòlai. Turn this table and place it crosswise. 
noun horizontal stroke (in a Chinese character) 
adverb dialect 1 in any case; anyway 我橫不那麼辦！ Wǒ héng bù nàme bàn! I’m not going to do that anyway. 2 most likely; probably 今天下雨, 他橫不來了。 Jīntiān xiàyǔ, tā héng bù lái le. It’s raining today; he most likely won’t come.

verb 1 lie 仰臥 yǎngwò lie on one’s back 2 dialect lay a baby down 把小孩臥在床上。 bǎ xiǎohái wò zàichuáng shàng. Lay the baby on the bed. 3 (of animals or birds) crouch; sit 4 figurative live in seclusion 5 dialect poach (eggs) 臥個雞子兒 wò ge jī zir poach an egg

OK, it’s settled. 好了, 不要再說了。 Hǎo le, bùyào zài shuō le. All right, no need to say any more. 好！ 那得多少錢！ Hǎo! Nà dé duōshao qián! Gosh! I can stand colder weather than this. 還有再大點兒的嗎？ Háiyǒu zài dà diǎnr de ma？ Have you got a bigger one? 聲音再大一點兒。 shēngyīn zài dà yīdiǎnr. auxiliary 1 [at the end of a special, alternative, or rhetorical question] 你剛纔到哪兒去了呢？ Nǐ gāngcái dào nǎr qù le ne？ Where were you just now? 你到底認不認得她呢？ Nǐ dào dǐ rèn bù rèn de tā ne？ Do you know her or not? 你對這件事是贊成呢, 還是反對呢？ Nǐ duì zhè jiàn shì shì zànchéng ne, hái shì fǎnduì ne？ Are you for or against this? 他們都有任務了, 我呢？ Tāmen dōu yǒu rènwu le, wǒ ne? They’ve got assignments, what about me? 我錯在哪兒呢？ Wǒ cuò zài nǎr ne？ What is my mistake? 我怎麼能不記得呢？ Wǒ zěnme néng bù jìde ne？ How could I forget this? 這點子事, 何必大驚小怪呢？ Zhè diǎnzi shì, hébì dàjīngxiǎoguài ne？ Why get so excited over such a little thing? 2 [at the end of a declarative sentence to reinforce the assertion] 遠得很, 有好幾千里地呢。 Yuǎn de hěn, yǒu hǎo jǐqiān lǐ dì ne. It’s a long way off—thousands of li away. 3 [at the end of a declarative sentence to indicate the continuation of an action or a state] 他還在生氣呢。 Tā hái zài shēngqì ne. He’s still angry. 張先生, 有人找你呢。 Zhāng xiānsheng, yǒurén zhǎo nǐ ne. Mr Zhang, somebody is looking for you. 4 [used to mark a pause] 不下雨呢, 就去;下雨呢, 就不去。 Bù xià yǔ ne,  jiù qù ； xiàyǔ ne, jiù bù qù. If it doesn’t rain, we’ll go; if it does, we won’t. 如今呢, 可比以往任何時候都要強。 Rújīn ne, kě bǐ yǐwǎng rènhé shíhou dōu yào qiáng. As for the present, things are far better than at any time in the past.

auxiliary 1 [indicating a suggestion, request or mild command] 咱們走吧。 Zánmen zǒu ba. Let’s go. 你好好兒想想吧！ Nǐ hǎohāor xiǎngxiang ba! Just think it over. 2 [indicating consent or approval] 明天就明天吧。 Míngtiān jiù míngtiān ba. All right, let’s make it tomorrow. 好吧, 就這麼辦吧！ Hǎo ba, jiù zhème bàn ba! O.K., that’s what we’ll do. 3 [in a leading question which asks for confirmation of a supposition] 他會來吧？ Tā huì lái ba？ He’ll come, won’t he? 你是中國人吧？ Nǐ shì Zhōngguó rén ba？ You are Chinese, I suppose (or I take it)? 4 [indicating some doubt in the speaker's mind] 他們走了吧。 Tāmen zǒu le ba. I suppose they’ve left. 他好像是這麼說的吧。 Tā hǎoxiàng shì zhème shuō de ba. That seems to be what he said. 5 [marking a pause after suppositions as alternatives] 去吧, 不好；不去吧, 也不好。 qù ba, bù hǎo; bù qù ba, yě bù hǎo. If I go, it’s no good; if I don’t, it’s no good either.

adverb very; very much; quite 很滿意 Hěn mǎnyì feel very satisfied; feel quite pleased 很有道理 hěn yǒu dàoli contain much truth; be quite correct 這幾天熱得很。 Zhè jǐ tiān rè de hěn. It’s been very hot these last few days. 他這個人好得很。 Tā zhège rén hǎo de hěn. He’s a very good man. 他覺得很不好受。 Tā juéde hěn bù hǎoshòu. He felt very bad. 我家離學校很近。 Wǒ jiā lí xuéxiào hěn jìn. I live quite near the school. 我近來身體不很好。 Wǒ jìnlái shēntǐ bù hěn hǎo. I haven’t felt very well recently. 現在他口袋裡很有幾個錢。 Xiànzài tā kǒudài lǐ hěn yǒu jǐ ge qián. He’s made himself quite a nice little pile. 這故事發生在很久很久以前。 Zhè gùshi fāshēng zài hěn jiǔ hěn jiǔ yǐqián. The story took place a long long time ago.

verb 1 see; look at; watch 看電視 kàn diànshì watch TV 看電影 kàn diànyǐng see a film; go to the movies 看球賽 kàn qiú sài watch a ball game 看演出 kàn yǎnchū attend a performance 看展覽 kàn zhǎnlǎn visit an exhibition 2 read (silently) 看報 kànbào read a newspaper 看譜 kànpǔ read music score 看書 kànshū read (a book) 3 think; consider; judge 看清形勢 kàn qīng xíngshì make a correct appraisal of the situation 全面地看問題 quánmiàn de kàn wèntí look at (or approach) an issue from all angles 你看她這個人可靠嗎？ Nǐ kàn tā zhège rén kěkào ma？ Do you think she’s reliable? 你對這件事怎麼看？ Nǐ duì zhè jiàn shì zěnme kàn？ What’s your view on this matter? 4 look upon; regard 把公眾的利益看得高於一切 bǎ gōngzhòng de lìyì kàn de gāoyú yīqiè put the interests of the public above all else 5 see (or consult) (a doctor); treat (a patient or an illness) 李大夫把她的肺炎看好了。 Lǐ dàifu bǎ tā de fèiyán kàn hǎo le. Dr. Li has cured her of pneumonia. 有病就該去看。 Yǒu bìng jiù gāi qù kàn. You ought to go and see a doctor when you are ill. 6 look after 衣帽自看。 Yī-mào zì kàn. Take care of your own hats and coats. 7 call on; visit; see 我明天去看他。 Wǒ míngtiān qù kàn tā. I’ll go and see him tomorrow. 有空我來看你。 Yǒukòng wǒ lái kàn nǐ. I’lldrop in on you when I have time. 8 depend on; rely on; fall back on 我們明天是不是出遊, 得看天氣。 wǒmen míngtiān shìbushì chūyóu, děikàn tiānqì. Whether we’ll go on a sightseeing trip tomorrow will depend on the weather. 9 mind; watch out 別跑這麼快！看摔著！ Bié pǎo zhème kuài! Kàn shuāi zhe! Don’t run so fast! Mind you don’t fall. 10 [before some verbs or adjectives] tend to; be expected See 24863488看跌kan4die1看跌 
auxiliary 1 [after a reduplicated verb or a verb phrase] try and see (what happens) 試試看 shìshikàn have a try 等一等看 děng yī děng kàn wait and see 嘗嘗看。 Chángchang kàn. Just taste this. 2 [in exclamations to express surprise or rebuke, esp. in the phrase 看你 or 你看你] 看你, 水都燒乾了。 Kàn nǐ, shuǐ dōu shāo gān le. Look what you’ve done! verb 1 think; ponder; consider 想辦法 xiǎng bànfǎ think of a way; seek a solution (or a way out) 想問題 xiǎng wèntí think over a problem 讓我想一想。 Ràng wǒ xiǎng yī xiǎng. Let me think it over. or Let me see. 你想得真周到。 Nǐ xiǎng de zhēn zhōudao. You have really thought of everything. 你想清楚了沒有？ Nǐ xiǎng qīngchu le méiyǒu？ Have you thought it out (or through)? 我們也要想想困難。 Wǒmen yě yào xiǎngxiǎng kùnnan. We must also anticipate difficulties. 我在想下一步棋該怎麼走。 Wǒ zài xiǎng xià yī bù qí gāi zěnme zǒu. I’m considering my next (chess) move. 2 think back; try to remember; recall; recollect 回想往事 huí xiǎng wǎngshì recall the past 你好好想想鑰匙擱哪兒了。 Nǐ hǎohāo xiǎngxiǎng yàoshi gē nǎr le. Think back carefully where you could have put the key. 3 suppose; reckon; consider; think 我想不至於吧。 Wǒ xiǎng bùzhìyú ba. I don’t believe things could get that bad. or Surely as bad as that! 我想我該走了。 Wǒ xiǎng wǒ gāi zǒu le. I’m afraid I must be going now. 你想他能買到票嗎？ Nǐ xiǎng tā néng mǎi dào piào ma？ Do you suppose he can get the tickets? 我想他今天不會來。 Wǒ xiǎng tā jīntiān bù huì lái. I don’t think he’ll come today. 4 want to; wish to; feel like (doing sth.) 我也想試試。 Wǒ yě xiǎng shìshi. I’d like to try too. 他很想上大學。 Tā hěn xiǎng shàng dàxué. He longs to go to college. 你想看足球賽嗎？ Nǐ xiǎng kàn zúqiúsài ma？ Do you want to see (or feel like seeing) a football match? 她不想跟我們去。 Tā bù xiǎng gēn wǒmen qù. She doesn’t wish to come with us. 5 remember with longing; miss 你走了以後, 我們都很想你。 Nǐ zǒu le yǐhòu, wǒmen dōu hěn xiǎng nǐ. After you left, we all missed you. 王大娘想女兒都想病了。 Wáng dàniáng xiǎng nǚ'ér dōu xiǎng bìng le. Auntie Wang misses her daughter so much she’s fallen ill.

verb 1 exist; be alive 人在人情在。 Rén zài rénqíng zài. Friendship lasts as long as the person remains. 他父親還在, 母親早就不在了。 Tā fùqin hái zài, mǔqin zǎo jiù bù zài le. The problem still exists and is not resolved yet. 2 be at, in, or on (a place) 你去那兒找他, 他準在。 Nǐ qù nàr zhǎo tā, tā zhǔn zài. Go and see him; he’s sure to be there. 他在家, 不在這兒。 Tā zài jiā, bù zài zhèr. verb 1 come (to); arrive 來得不巧 Láide bùqiǎo come at an unsuitable time (or moment) 來得正好 láide zhènghǎo come in good time; come just at the right time 就來！ jiù lái! I’m coming. 快來！ Kuài lái! He has already come. 她明天來北京。 Tā míngtiān lái Běijīng. She is coming to Beijing tomorrow. 有空來玩。 Yǒukòng lái wán. Come round when you have time. 遠處來了一條小船。 Yuǎnchù lái le yī tiáo xiǎochuán. A small boat came into view in the distance. 2 cause to come; happen; crop up; take place 問題來了。 Wèntí lái le. A problem has come up. 這事兒怎麼來的？ Zhè shìr zěnme lái de？ How did it come about? 3 obtain; get 這差事來得不容易。 Zhè chāishilái de bù róngyì. This job is hard to come by. 4 [as a substitute for some other verb] 來份糖醋魚。 lái fèn tángcùyú. A sweet-and-sour fish, please. 你來塊糖。 Nǐ lái kuài táng. Have some candy. 再來一個！ Zàilái yī ge! [call for another performance] Encore! 慢慢兒來, 別忙。 Mànmànr lái, bié máng. Take it easy. No hurry. 我累了, 你來吧。 Wǒ lèi le, nǐ lái ba. I’m tired. Why don’t you take over (or carry on). 咱們來一盤棋。 Zánmenlái yī pán qí. Let’s have a game of chess. 你歇歇, 讓我來吧。 Nǐ xiēxie, ràng wǒ lái ba. You take a rest. Let me do it. 我自己來吧, 別客氣。 Wǒ zìjǐ lái ba, bié kèqi. Please don’t bother. I’ll do it myself. 我們打籃球, 你來不來？ Wǒmen dǎ lánqiú, nǐ lái bù lái？ We’re going to play basketball. Will you join in? 5 [with 得 or 不, indicating possibility or impossibility, capability or incapability] 上海話我說不來。 Shànghǎi huà wǒ shuō bù lái. I don’t speak Shanghai dialect. 我吃不來四川菜。 Wǒ chī bù lái Sìchuān cài. I can’t get used to Sichuan cuisine. 西餐我吃得來。 Xīcān wǒ chī de lái. Western food suits me all right. 這道題我做不來。 Zhè dào tí wǒ zuò bù lái. I can’t do this problem. 這個歌我唱得來。 Zhège gē wǒ chàng de lái. I can sing this song. 6 [before a verb, indicating an intended or suggested action] 你來試試。 Nǐ lái shìshi. Have a try. 我來說兩句。 Wǒ láishuō liǎng jù. Let me say a few words. 大家來想辦法。 Dàjiā lái xiǎng bànfǎ. Let’s think of a way (to solve the problem). or Let’s put our heads together and see how to do it. 7 [after a verb or verbal expression] come in order to 他回家探親來了。 Tā huíjiā tànqīn lái le. He’s come home to see his parents. 我們道喜來了。 Wǒmen dàoxǐ lái le.
